page.title: 14A Teenager's view of Hunton
page.content: Young people,aged 15_23 or so,living in Hunton have generally found it easy to get a job at the end of schooling. Several towns are within easy reach of here so we feel that we have a greater chance of finding work. Vacancies are found through relations,friends or the "D.and S." newspaper. We can be roughly split into three groups. Some of us attend colleges to start off our careers. Others begin employment straight away and there are those who have been occasionally in and out of jobs. Youth unemployment in Hunton is quite rare. Despite lack of public services travelling causes few difficulties. Our parents or friends give us lifts until we can get our own transport. Most of us gather at the greens on a night to talk and have a laugh. On the whole we like living and being involved in this village.
